comment: Scenario E:
1. Spend time training at Al Qaeda center in Afghanistan
2. Wire transfer from an uncle
3. Enter US illegally
4. Possess bomb making instruction
5. Contact Sheikh connected with Rabbi Kahane Murderer
6. Get financing from Sheikh
7. Train in NJ
8. Mail anti-Israel letters to newspapers
9. Rent a van
10. Drive to Manhattan
11. Park at WTC (1993)
12. Bomb explosion killing 6 people
13. Escaped to Pakistan
Conceptually, Coordinated Bombing Attack extends caci:Schemas/BombingAttack, but this may be out of scope for Phase I.
NOTE: This is the TA2 complex event.
schemas.name: World Trade Center 1993 Attack
schemas.description: A terrorist attack on the World Trade Center, carried out on 2/26/1993, when a truck bomb detonated below the North Tower

privateData.comment: Performers can place any keys/values they wish here.  The map will be added to the graph but otherwise ignored by the system.  Properties maps can be added inside a schema, individual steps, slots, and order blocks, but not in their enclosing arrays.  Large amounts of private data can be stored on S3 and linked via a key in the map.  The intention is to validate the size (in bytes) of the object does not exceed a defined maximum.

steps.name: Spend time training at Al Qaeda center in Afghanistan
steps.provenance: Performer-specific info that tracks the origin of the event.

comment: TA1 optionally sets minDuration and maxDuration; TA2 sets duration, confidence, and provenance of this object
See Conflict.DetonateExplode step for absoluteTime example

participants.name: trainer
participants.comment: Reference specifies that the trainer is Al-Qaeda.

values.comment: TA2 can and should specify entityTypes in values objects to express the type of the slot filler/extracted entity.  This can be as specific as the extractors can detect, and may be more specific than the entity types specified in the TA1 schema.

participants.name: amount
participants.comment: In WireTransfer, the Amount slot fills the Donation's Item role, and restricts it to MON

participants.name: place
participants.comment: In WireTransfer, the Carrier slot fills the Donation's Place slot, and restricts it to ORG (e.g., Western Union

steps.name: Contact Sheikh connected with Rabbi Kahane Murderer
comment: Note that TA1 has broken up the Contact primitive's Participant role into two distinct slots, so that they
can assign reference and refvars to both participants individually.
TA2 can specify entityTypes in values objects to express the type of the slot filler/extracted entity.
Multiple entity types are typically expressed with AND semantics.

steps.name: Mail anti-Israel letters to newspapers
steps.comment: caci:Primitives/Contact.Propaganda is a specialization of the Contact.Broadcast event primitive

participants.name: vehicle_rented
participants.comment: This shows an example of refvar used in primitive slots, not schema slot arguments.

values.value: parking garage beneath the World Trade Center
1,336 lb (606 kg) urea nitrate–hydrogen gas enhanced device

order.comment: Wire transfer occurs while training with Al-Qaeda.  Contrived to show a container/contained example.
Mailing anti-Israel letters to newspapers and training in NJ overlap.  Contrived to show an overlaps example.
At some point, the system should be able to infer transitive relations.  Not sure if in Phase I.

entityRelations.description: Wire transfer was from recipient's uncle

comment: Sheikh participant from make_contact event is connected with Rabbi Kahane Murderer.
This corresponds to 'Each argument may be associated with a relation which may be useful to differentiate between schema' from "Structure of a schema"
Same attacker moved to specific location as moved to general location, or lives in general attack location
This corresponds to 'argument A32 could be identical with A21 or related to A22' from "Structure of a schema"

relations.comment: Same attacker moved to specific location as moved to general location
Attacker lives in general attack location

entityRelations.description: Giver of financing is one of the participants in the make_contact event, or is affiliated with it
entityRelations.comment: This corresponds to 'Arguments A41 and A51 are either identical or related' from "Structure of a schema"

relations.comment: Giver of financing is one of the participants in the make_contact event
Giver of financing is affiliated with one of the participants in the make_contact event

entityRelations.comment: It is recommended to add a name, description, or refvar (if relevant) to clarify intended entity-entity relations for annotators and evaluators
entityRelations.name: vehicle relations
entityRelations.description: Rented vehicle was yellow a Yellow Ryder
